Package algorithm

Class degreeDiscount

java.lang.Object
algorithm.degreeDiscount
public class degreeDiscount
extends java.lang.Object
Represents results of degree discount on simulationRuns. Reference: Chen, Wei, Yajun Wang, and Siyu Yang. "Efficient influence maximization in social networks." Proceedings of the 15th ACM SIGKDD international conference on Knowledge discovery and data mining. 2009.
Author:
Sudesh Agrawal (sudesh@utexas.edu). Last Updated: September 23, 2020.

  • Field Details

    • outputMap

      java.util.Map<parameters,​algorithmOutput> outputMap
      A map from parameters to algorithmOutput. Basically, stores the outputs for different input parameters.

      Parameters: (model (TN11C, RAEPC, etc.), network name, time step, repetitions, false negative probability, transmissability (p), number of honeypots).

      Algorithm output: objective value, honeypot, wall time, a priori upper bound, and posterior upper bound.

    • writeToCSV

      public void writeToCSV​(java.lang.String filename, boolean append) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes algorithm results to csv file.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to output file
      append - true, if you wish to append to existing file; false, otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - thrown if error in input-output operation.

    • runSAAUsingKHighestDegreeSingleDiscountNodes

      public void runSAAUsingKHighestDegreeSingleDiscountNodes​(graph g, simulationRuns simulationResults, java.util.List<parameters> listOfParams) throws java.lang.Exception
      Find the k highest degree nodes after single discount to use as honeypots and evaluates the objective value, upper bounds and execution time.
      Parameters:
      g - network graph
      simulationResults - results of simulation as an instance of simulationRuns
      listOfParams - list of the set of parameters used to get simulationResults.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if the graph g has self loops, or if the label of a node in g is a negative integer, or if the network name in one of the parameters and the network name stored in the graph g do not match, or if the number of nodes is less than the number of honeypots in any of the parameters in listOfParams.
